text: Asociality holds a similar definition to antisocial which describes someone who does not participate in society and stays out of social interactions with other people. == Holocaust Connection == Asociality was a marking given to prisoners of the Nazi Regime working/living in concentration camps which was used to describe a prisoner which was used to describe someone who was "Work- shy" or someone who did not participate in work. This typically included people who were, beggars, alcoholics, drug addicts, prostitutes and pacifists. Roma and Sinti people were also classified as 'asocial'. Asocial people were marked with a black inverted triangle. ==References==
